word.rem: jisho has n5; appears in GENKI1 L5; moved to n4, because 熱 is not n5, which causes ambiguity with atsui-hotweather

sentence.s: このお【茶：ちゃ】はとても【熱：あつ】い。
sentence.rom: Kono o-cha wa totemo atsui.
sentence.tr_en: This tea is very hot.
sentence.tr_de: Dieser Tee ist sehr heiss.

sentence.s: このプールは、【真：ま】ん【中：なか】が【一：いち】【番：ばん】【深：ふか】いから、【気：き】を【付：つ】けてください。
sentence.rom: Kono pūru wa, mannaka ga ichiban fukai kara, ki o tsukete kudasai.
sentence.tr_en: The centre of this pool is the most deep, so please be careful.
sentence.tr_de: In diesem Pool ist die Mitte am tiefsten, also bitte seien Sie vorsichtig.

phrase.tr_en: to sleep lightly; to have a shallow sleep
phrase.tr_de: untief schlafen; einen flachen Schlaf haben

sentence.s: この【川：かわ】はあそこで【浅：あさ】くなっている。
sentence.rom: Kono kawa wa asoko de asaku natte iru.
sentence.tr_en: This river becomes shallow at that point.
sentence.tr_de: Der Fluss wird dort untief.

sentence.s: このベッドは【硬：かた】くて、【寝：ね】にくい。
sentence.rom: Kono beddo wa katakute, ne-nikui.
sentence.tr_en: This bed is hard and difficult to sleep in.
sentence.tr_de: Dieses Bett ist hart, es ist schwer, drin zu schlafen.

sentence.s: すみません。お【肉：にく】は【硬：かた】いですが。
sentence.rom: Sumimasen. O-niku wa katai desu ga.
sentence.tr_en: Excuse me. The meat is tough.
sentence.tr_de: Entschuldigen Sie. Das Fleisch ist zäh.

phrase.rem: verified with ChatGPT and the web

sentence.s: 【色：いろ】【々：いろ】な【珍：めずら】しい【食：た】べ【物：もの】を【出：だ】してくれた。
sentence.rom: Iro-iro na mezurashii tabemono o dashite kureta.
sentence.tr_en: They served me various unusual foods.
sentence.tr_de: Sie tischten mir diverse ungewöhnliche Esswaren auf.

sentence.s: 【妻：つま】が 【今日：きょう】 【珍：めずら】しく【弁：べん】【当：とう】を【作：つく】ってくれた。
sentence.rom: Tsuma ga kyō mezurashiku bentō o tsukutte kureta.
sentence.tr_en: Most unusually, my wife made me a boxed lunch today.
sentence.tr_de: Ungewöhnlicherweise hat mir meine Frau heute eine Lunchbox gemacht.

sentence.s: 【先：せん】【生：せい】に【珍：めずら】しい【漢：かん】【字：じ】を【教：おし】えていただきました。
sentence.rom: Sensei ni mezurashii kanji o oshiete itadakimashita.
sentence.tr_en: I had my professor teach me some rare kanji.
sentence.tr_de: Ich habe von meinem Lehrer seltene Kanjis gelehrt bekommen.

sentence.s: それは【優：やさ】しいですね。
sentence.rom: Sore wa yasashii desu ne.
sentence.tr_en: That's kind.
sentence.tr_de: Das ist lieb.

sentence.s: 【木：き】【村：むら】さんは【優：やさ】しい【人：ひと】です。
sentence.rom: Kimura-san wa yasashii hito desu.
sentence.tr_en: Miss Kimura is a kind person.
sentence.tr_de: Frau Kimura ist eine nette Person.

sentence.s: あなたの【言：い】うことは【正：ただ】しいと【思：おも】います。
sentence.rom: Anata no iu koto wa tadashii to omoimasu.
sentence.tr_en: I think what you're saying is correct.
sentence.tr_de: Ich denke, es ist korrekt, was du sagst.

sentence.s: どれが【正：ただ】しいか【分：わ】かりません。
sentence.rom: Dore ga tadashii ka wakarimasen.
sentence.tr_en: I don't know which one is correct.
sentence.tr_de: Ich weiss nicht, welcher der richtige ist.
sentence.rem: uses the same grammatical structure as the sentence in GENKI2 p.189

sentence.s: 【私：わたし】の【車：くるま】はどこかおかしい。
sentence.rom: Watashi no kuruma wa dokoka okashii.
sentence.tr_en: There is something wrong with my car.
sentence.tr_de: Etwas stimmt mit meinem Auto nicht.

sentence.s: 【頭：あたま】がおかしくなりそうだな〜
sentence.rom: Atama ga okashiku narisō da na~
sentence.tr_en: I think I'm going crazy…
sentence.tr_de: Ich glaub, ich werd verrückt…

sentence.s: その【先：せん】【生：せい】は【生：せい】【徒：と】に【厳：きび】しい。
sentence.rom: Sono sensei wa seito ni kibishii.
sentence.tr_en: That teacher is strict with his students.
sentence.tr_de: Dieser Lehrer ist streng zu seinen Schülern.

sentence.s: 【細：こま】かい【雨：あめ】が【降：ふ】っていた。
sentence.rom: Komakai ame ga futte ita.
sentence.tr_en: It was raining lightly.
sentence.tr_de: Es regnete leicht.

phrase.ph: すごく【速：はや】い【電：でん】【車：しゃ】

sentence.s: 【山：やま】【下：した】さんはすごい【雪：ゆき】のために【遅：おく】れた。
sentence.rom: Yamashita-san wa sugoi yuki no tame ni okureta.
sentence.tr_en: Mr Yamashita was late because of the heavy snow.
sentence.tr_de: Herr Yamashita verspätete sich wegen des starken Schnees.

word.rem: jisho has n3; appears in GENKI2 L20 vocab section as yoroshikattara, if it's okay

phrase.ph: よろしい【計：けい】【画：かく】
phrase.explanation_en: よろしい is more formal 良い or いい
phrase.explanation_de: よろしい ist formeller als 良い oder いい

sentence.s: よろしくお【願：ねが】いします！
sentence.rom: Yoroshiku o-negai shimasu!
sentence.tr_en: Nice to meet you!
sentence.tr_de: Schön, Sie kennenzulernen!

sentence.s: 【汚：きたな】い【灰：はい】【皿：ざら】を【取：と】ってもよろしいでしょうか。
sentence.rom: Kitanai haizara o totte mo yoroshii deshō ka?
sentence.tr_en: Is it alright if I take the dirty ashtray?
sentence.tr_de: Ist es in Ordnung, wenn ich den dreckigen Aschenbecher mitnehme?

sentence.s: このコーヒー、【苦：にが】いよ。
sentence.rom: Kono kōhī, nigai yo.
sentence.tr_en: This coffee is bitter.
sentence.tr_de: Dieser Kaffee ist bitter.

sentence.s: この【薬：くすり】は【苦：にが】い【味：あじ】がする。
sentence.rom: Kono kusuri wa nigai aji ga suru.
sentence.tr_en: This medicine has a bitter taste.
sentence.tr_de: Diese Medizin hat einen bitteren Geschmack.

phrase.ph: 【柔：やわ】らかい【洗：せん】【濯：たく】【物：もの】

sentence.s: この【牛：ぎゅう】【肉：にく】は【柔：やわ】らかい。
sentence.rom: Kono gyūniku wa yawarakai.
sentence.tr_en: This beef is tender.
sentence.tr_de: Dieses Rindfleisch ist zart.

sentence.s: 【私：わたし】は【柔：やわ】らかいベッドで【眠：ねむ】るのが【好：す】きです。
sentence.rom: Watashi wa yawarakai beddo de nemuru no ga suki desu.
sentence.tr_en: I like sleeping in a soft bed.
sentence.tr_de: Ich mag es, in einem weichen Bett zu schlafen.

sentence.s: そんな【悲：かな】しい【目：め】で【見：み】ないで。
sentence.rom: Sonna kanashii me de minaide.
sentence.tr_en: Don't give me such a sad look.
sentence.tr_de: Schau nicht mit so traurigen Augen.

sentence.s: 【犬：いぬ】が【死：し】んで【悲：かな】しかったでしょう。
sentence.rom: Inu ga shinde kanashikatta deshō.
sentence.tr_en: You must have been sad when the dog died.
sentence.tr_de: Du warst sicher traurig, als der Hund starb.
sentence.rem: deshō is tentative, see Oxford p.118

sentence.s: 【君：きみ】がいなくて【寂：さび】しいよ。
sentence.rom: Kimi ga inakute sabishii yo.
sentence.tr_en: I miss you.
sentence.tr_de: Ich vermisse dich.
sentence.explanation_en: lit.: You are not there, and it's lonely.
sentence.explanation_de: wörtl.: Du bist nicht da, und es ist einsam.

sentence.s: 【眠：ねむ】そうだね。【大：だい】【丈：じょう】【夫：ぶ】？
sentence.rom: Nemusō da ne. Daijōbu?
sentence.tr_en: You look sleepy. Are you okay?
sentence.tr_de: Du schaust schläfrig aus. Alles in Ordnung?

sentence.s: 【犬：いぬ】が【怖：こわ】いですか。
sentence.rom: Inu ga kowai desu ka?
sentence.tr_en: Are you frightened of dogs?
sentence.tr_de: Hast du Angst vor Hunden?

phrase.ph: 【恥：は】ずかしい【失：しっ】【敗：ぱい】

sentence.s: みんなの【前：まえ】で【間：ま】【違：ちが】えて とても 【恥：は】ずかしかった。
sentence.rom: Minna no mae de machigaete totemo hazukashikatta.
sentence.tr_en: I was so embarrassed after making a mistake in front of everyone.
sentence.tr_de: Es war so peinlich, als ich vor allen einen Fehler machte.

sentence.s: 【初：はじ】めて【人：ひと】に【会：あ】うのはとても【恥：は】ずかしい。
sentence.rom: Hajimete hito ni au no wa totemo hazukashii.
sentence.tr_en: I feel totally embarrassed when I meet somebody for the first time.
sentence.tr_de: Ich fühle mich total verlegen, wenn ich jemanden zum ersten Mal treffe.

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.24 vocab section; jisho has n3

phrase.ph: 【嬉：うれ】しそうなお【年：とし】【寄：よ】り

sentence.s: 【台：たい】【風：ふう】が【過：す】ぎたと【聞：き】いて【嬉：うれ】しかった。
sentence.rom: Taifū ga sugita to kīte ureshikatta.
sentence.tr_en: I was glad to hear that the typhoon had passed.
sentence.tr_de: Ich war froh, als ich hörte, dass der Taifun vorüber ist.

word.rem: appears in 500mon q434; jisho has n3

sentence.s: やっぱりダメでしたか。
sentence.rom: Yappari dame deshita ka?
sentence.tr_en: So it was no good after all?
sentence.tr_de: War es doch nicht gut?
sentence.rem: jisho has n2 for yappari, n3 for dame

sentence.s: もうダメだ！
sentence.rom: Mō dame da!
sentence.tr_en: It's all in vain!
sentence.tr_de: Es bringt alles nichts!

word.rem: appears in 500mon q45; jisho has n3

sentence.s: 【父：ちち】は【私：わたし】に【素：す】【敵：てき】な【時：と】【計：けい】をくれた。
sentence.rom: Chichi wa watashi ni suteki na tokei o kureta.
sentence.tr_en: My father gave me a nice watch.
sentence.tr_de: Mein Vater hat mir eine hübsche Uhr gegeben.

phrase.tr_en: to overdo it; to push oneself too hard

sentence.s: ちょっと【無：む】【理：り】ですね。
sentence.rom: Chotto muri desu ne.
sentence.tr_en: It's a bit difficult.
sentence.tr_de: Es ist etwas schwierig.

sentence.s: あまり【無：む】【理：り】するなよ。
sentence.rom: Amari muri suru na yo.
sentence.tr_en: Don't overdo it.
sentence.tr_de: Übertreibe es nicht.

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 L21 vocab section

sentence.s: 【変：へん】な【音：おと】が【聞：き】こえる。
sentence.rom: Hen na oto ga kikoeru.
sentence.tr_en: I hear a strange sound.
sentence.tr_de: Man hört ein seltsames Geräusch.

sentence.s: この【牛：ぎゅう】【乳：にゅう】、【変：へん】なにおいがしているよ。
sentence.rom: Kono gyūnyū, hen na nioi ga shite iru yo.
sentence.tr_en: This milk smells strange.
sentence.tr_de: Diese Milch riecht komisch.

word.Langenscheidt: wichtig; daiji ni suru: wertschätzen, schonen
word.rem: ChatGPT says taisetsu is more about personal value, while daiji is more sth of general significance

phrase.tr_en: to treat sth. with importance; to cherish sb.
phrase.tr_de: sorgfältig mit etw. umgehen; jem. wertschätzen

sentence.s: お【大：だい】【事：じ】に。
sentence.rom: O-daiji ni.
sentence.tr_en: Get well soon.
sentence.tr_de: Gute Besserung.
sentence.explanation_en: short for お大事にしてください
sentence.explanation_de: Kurzform von お大事にしてください
sentence.rem: jisho has n2 for o-daiji ni; also appears in GENKI1 p.269 vocab section

sentence.s: この【時：と】【計：けい】は、【祖：そ】【父：ふ】がくれたものなので、【大：だい】【事：じ】にしています。
sentence.rom: Kono tokei wa, sofu ga kureta mono na no de, daiji ni shite imasu.
sentence.tr_en: I treat this watch with great importance, because my grandfather gave it to me.
sentence.tr_de: Da ich diese Uhr von meinem Grossvater bekommen habe, gehe ich sehr sorgfältig damit um.

sentence.s: 【鍵：かぎ】が【必：ひつ】【要：よう】です。
sentence.rom: Kagi ga hitsuyō desu.
sentence.tr_en: I need a key.
sentence.tr_de: Ich brauche einen Schlüssel.

sentence.s: 【乗：の】り【換：か】える【必：ひつ】【要：よう】がありますか。
sentence.rom: Norikaeru hitsuyō ga arimasu ka?
sentence.tr_en: Do I need to transfer (change trains)?
sentence.tr_de: Muss ich umsteigen?
sentence.rem: hitsuyō is a noun here, though

sentence.s: このはがきは【切：きっ】【手：て】を【貼：は】る【必：ひつ】【要：よう】がありません。
sentence.rom: Kono hagaki wa kitte o haru hitsuyō ga arimasen.
sentence.tr_en: There is no need to put a stamp on this postcard.
sentence.tr_de: Bei dieser Postkarte muss man keine Briefmarke drauf kleben.

phrase.ph: 【適：てき】【当：とう】な【言：こと】【葉：ば】
phrase.explanation_en: Can have a negative connotation, so it could mean 'inappropriate words' depending on the situation.
phrase.explanation_de: Kann einen negativen Beiklang haben, deshalb kann es unter Umständen auch 'unpassende Worte' heissen.
phrase.rem: verified with ChatGPT; ChatGPT says it may have a negative connotation

sentence.s: 【適：てき】【当：とう】な【時：とき】にナオミにそれを【言：い】いましょう。
sentence.rom: Tekitō na toki ni Naomi ni sore o īmashō.
sentence.tr_en: I will tell Naomi at the proper time.
sentence.tr_de: Ich werde es Naomi zur passenden Zeit sagen.

phrase.ph: 【残：ざん】【念：ねん】な【失：しっ】【敗：ぱい】

sentence.s: 【残：ざん】【念：ねん】です。
sentence.rom: Zannen desu.
sentence.tr_en: That's too bad.
sentence.tr_de: Das ist schade.

sentence.s: 【残：ざん】【念：ねん】ながら、【今日：きょう】はダメです。
sentence.rom: Zannen nagara, kyō wa dame desu.
sentence.tr_en: Unfortunately, it's impossible today.
sentence.tr_de: Heute geht es leider nicht.

phrase.ph: 【簡：かん】【単：たん】な【料：りょう】【理：り】

sentence.s: 【簡：かん】【単：たん】そう！
sentence.rom: Kantansō!
sentence.tr_en: (It) looks easy!
sentence.tr_de: (Es) schaut einfach aus!

sentence.s: 【簡：かん】【単：たん】じゃなさそう！
sentence.rom: Kantan janasasō!
sentence.tr_en: (It) doesn't look easy!
sentence.tr_de: (Es) schaut nicht (gerade) einfach aus!

sentence.s: 【確：たし】かなことが【一：ひと】つある。
sentence.rom: Tashika na koto ga hito-tsu aru.
sentence.tr_en: There is one thing that is certain.
sentence.tr_de: Eins ist sicher.

word.rem: is now a phrase in tashika-sure

phrase.rem: appears in 500mon q256; jisho has n3 for kyū ni, but n4 for kyū

sentence.s: 【赤：あか】ちゃんが【急：きゅう】に【泣：な】き【出：だ】した。
sentence.rom: Aka-chan ga kyū ni nakidashita.
sentence.tr_en: The baby suddenly started crying.
sentence.tr_de: Das Baby hat plötzlich zu schreien angefangen.

word.rem: is now a phrase in kyū-urgent
appears in GENKI1 p.210 vocab section; jisho has n2

sentence.s: ヨシはいつも【私：わたし】に【意：い】【地：じ】【悪：わる】するよ。
sentence.rom: Yoshi wa itsumo watashi ni ijiwaru suru yo.
sentence.tr_en: Yoshi is always being mean to me.
sentence.tr_de: Yoshi ist immer gemein zu mir.

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 p.49 vocabulary section; jisho has n3 with katakana ケチ; Langenscheidt: けち geizig

sentence.s: お【金：かね】【持：も】ちかもしれないけど、ケチだ。
sentence.rom: O-kanemochi kamo shirenai kedo, kechi da.
sentence.tr_en: He may be rich, but he's a cheapskate.
sentence.tr_de: Er mag zwar reich sein, aber er ist ein Geizhals.
sentence.rem: verified with ChatGPT; using katakana, because it seems equally common and improves readability here

sentence.s: あなたの【町：まち】はどんな【産：さん】【業：ぎょう】が【盛：さか】んですか。
sentence.rom: Anata no machi wa donna sangyō ga sakan desu ka?
sentence.tr_en: What industries are thriving in your town?
sentence.tr_de: Welche Industrie ist in deiner Stadt am florieren?

sentence.s: 【映：えい】【画：が】【産：さん】【業：ぎょう】は【盛：さか】んだと【思：おも】う。
sentence.rom: Eiga sangyō wa sakan da to omou.
sentence.tr_en: I think the film industry is thriving.
sentence.tr_de: Ich denke, die Filmindustrie floriert.

phrase.ph: 【十：じゅう】【分：ぶん】な【食：しょく】【料：りょう】【品：ひん】

sentence.s: まだ【十：じゅう】【分：ぶん】な【時：じ】【間：かん】がある。
sentence.rom: Mada jūbun na jikan ga aru.
sentence.tr_en: There is still plenty of time.
sentence.tr_de: Wir haben immer noch genügend Zeit.

phrase.ph: 【丁：てい】【寧：ねい】な【言：こと】【葉：ば】
【丁：てい】【寧：ねい】な【仕：し】【事：ごと】

sentence.s: 【谷：たに】【口：ぐち】さんは【電：でん】【話：わ】で【丁：てい】【寧：ねい】に【話：はな】していらっしゃいます。
sentence.rom: Taniguchi-san wa denwa de teinei ni hanashite irasshaimasu.
sentence.tr_en: Mrs Taniguchi is politely talking on the phone.
sentence.tr_de: Frau Taniguchi redet (gerade) höflich am Telefon.
sentence.explanation_en: いらっしゃる is more polite than いる
sentence.explanation_de: いらっしゃる ist höflicher als いる

word.rem: appears in GENKI2 L22 vocab section

phrase.ph: 【自：じ】【由：ゆう】な【社：しゃ】【会：かい】
【経：けい】【済：ざい】の【自：じ】【由：ゆう】

sentence.s: 【自：じ】【由：ゆう】に【意：い】【見：けん】を【言：い】えることは【大：たい】【切：せつ】です。
sentence.rom: Jiyū ni iken o ieru koto wa taisetsu desu.
sentence.tr_en: It is important to be able to say one's opinions freely.
sentence.tr_de: Es ist wichtig, dass man die eigene Meinung frei sagen kann.

phrase.ph: 【親：しん】【切：せつ】なおじいさん

sentence.s: あそこの【店：てん】【員：いん】さんは【親：しん】【切：せつ】です。
sentence.rom: Asoko no ten'in-san wa shinsetsu desu.
sentence.tr_en: That place's store attendant is really nice.
sentence.tr_de: Die Verkäuferin von jenem Ort ist sehr freundlich.

phrase.ph: 【熱：ねっ】【心：しん】な【研：けん】【究：きゅう】【者：しゃ】

sentence.s: 【小：こ】【山：やま】さんは【熱：ねっ】【心：しん】に【仕：し】【事：ごと】をしています。
sentence.rom: Koyama-san wa nesshin ni shigoto o shite imasu.
sentence.tr_en: Mrs Koyama is working eagerly.
sentence.tr_de: Frau Koyama arbeitet eifrig.

sentence.s: そんな【珍：めずら】しい【魚：さかな】を【食：た】べるのはすごく【特：とく】【別：べつ】な【経：けい】【験：けん】だった。
sentence.rom: Sonna mezurashii sakana o taberu no wa sugoku tokubetsu na keiken datta.
sentence.tr_en: To eat such a rare fish was a very extraordinary experience.
sentence.tr_de: Einen solch seltenen Fisch essen war eine ganz aussergewöhnliche Erfahrung.

word.rem: jisho has n3 for hijō, but n4 for hijō ni

phrase.ph: 【非：ひ】【常：じょう】な【危：き】【険：けん】
【非：ひ】【常：じょう】に【怒：おこ】っている

sentence.s: 【非：ひ】【常：じょう】に【困：こま】っています。
sentence.rom: Hijō ni komatte imasu.
sentence.tr_en: I am in deep trouble.
sentence.tr_de: Ich befinde mich in einer extrem schwierigen Lage.
